EVAS + Gulfstream

EVAS has been widely adopted among operators of Private Jets, with over 1000 EVAS units having been installed on Gulfstream Aircraft.

Smoke is the leading defined cause of emergency landing for ETOPS

After numerous incidences of smoke impeding pilots’ vision, and with catastrophic loss as a result, VisionSafe Corporation came up with the solution. Gulfstream Aerospace has designated EVAS as standard client option for their prestigious line of jet aircraft.

EVAS is equipped on over 1000 Gulfstream Aircraft.

Certified for use on 10 OEMs and over 120 Aircraft Type.

Well over 2000 ETOPS aircraft are EVAS equipped.

An overview of the Emergency Vision Assurance System

Pilot Hugh V. Tillman talks about his blinding smoke in the cockpit incident

An overview of the Emergency Vision Assurance System

Gulfstream Supplier of the Year

After thorough evaluation and review Gulfstream awarded VisionSafe as supplier of the year. Gulfstream has also designated EVAS as a standard equipment on the G650 and as standard client option for the rest of their prestigious line of aircraft.

If you’d have offered me the product in the middle of my emergency, I’d have agreed to pay my entire year’s salary for it.

Having something like this, just to see a two-foot distance to your instruments would have been golden. You don’t appreciate being able to see something till you can’t see it.

- Captain Brian S.
